Title: Grasping the global with Digital Earth
Source: IOP Conf. Ser. Earth Environ. Sci.
Abstract: © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.This study examined the extent to which adopting a more subject-led approach to teaching with the interactive geospatial tool, the Climate HotMap, can enhance geographical knowledge and understanding of climate change. Findings showed the significance of teachers paying more attention to geography's central concepts of place, space, interconnection and environment in understanding the impact of climate change on local places but also on the relations between places in the bigger global climate change picture.
